data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

First, the left hand enters the right hand. Take 9 steps right of the first two steps. Then, take 9 steps left of the first two steps. And the right hand enters the left hand. The whole sequence in all directions is repeated. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps and turn around. Take 4 steps and turn around. Take right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you get to a starting point that is 5 feet away, take 6 steps. If you start at an upright position that has less than 10 steps, Take 4 steps. If you are standing still on a vertical plane, take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After going back 7 steps, you are no longer in the starting point. The answer: no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can not turn around and take 5 step back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The directions have been done multiple times and all are the same movement. It is a different direction every time. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps back to the starting point.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
First, take 6 steps back, then take 2 steps. It is then 2 and you are back at the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Your body can only go as far as you think. It never needs to reverse direction, just goes in the same direction for the first step. Even if you move your body as far as you think you can, it will only go as far as you think. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 2 steps forward. That way you can pick up where you left off and bring yourself back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
While facing forward, one should still be able to move forward but not backward like when facing forward. Moving forward means moving forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If someone follows the directions, they always have to face forward. When someone takes 6 steps backward they are no longer facing forward. Everyone then takes 8 steps right to get back to where they started. When someone takes 1 step backward they are not facing forward. If someone takes 5 steps left they are in the middle and when someone takes 2 steps they are in the middle. If you return to the starting point with all you have they would have to face forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The whole set of instructions refers to your starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can only go forward 1 step at a time. If you face forward, you can go forward 1, 2, 3, and 5. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let’ s say you always face forward. In order to return to the starting point, 1st place is always taken to the left side. If you start this way, you take 3 steps right, then 1 step backward and then 6 steps left. If you start this way, take 4 steps right, then 1 step forward and then 3 steps right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If someone takes 5 steps to turn around he doesn’t get himself back on the starting line. Thus, the answer is No.

The first method is one way, not the other. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can repeat a set of steps until you have returned to your starting point. If you can repeat the same number of steps, you have repeat the set of steps for 14 steps. The number for rounding back to the starting point is 9. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The number of steps needed to go back to the starting point is 9. If we took 6 steps, that would come to 9 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right then turn right. Doing the instructions will return you to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn left and take 3 steps.Take a step and take 1 step. Turn left again and take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take the second part in time, you will take 3 steps first and return to the starting point in 20 seconds. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The initial starting point is at the place 1 started, or 3 steps ahead from the starting point. To take 3 steps back, you take 7 (first start step, then 7th step, then 9th step) The total number of steps required to get back to the starting point is 5 (7 first start step, then 7th step, then 9th step) so overall it is a 7 ( first start step, then 7th step, then 9th step) + 3 ( first start step, then 10th step, then 9th step). So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Do you need to face forward? It cannot be done as you would avert your mind to it. If you look forward, you will not be walking forward. If you look backward, you are going backward. Taking 5 steps backward will take you 5 steps forward. Taking 7 steps forward will take you 7 steps forward. Taking 2 steps right will take you 2 steps backward. Taking 7 steps forward will take you 2 steps forward. Being reverse will take you backwards. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps backward, then take 9 steps left. The starting point is facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around you take 4 steps. When you come back to the starting point you take 4 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Don’ t take your mind off the direction and the direction you have just moved. Your mind must work out the direction and the direction of the moving point. You cannot simply change directions. So, the answer is No.

The final sentence of the two instructions returns to the starting point of turn right. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 6 different ways to take steps backwards, and 8 steps forward has 8 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

To get back to the beginning, you would take three steps. So, the answer is Yes.

The same directions would return you to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Each instruction has a number given. At first, you face forward. To correct for the incorrect number, you would take 10 steps right. The starting point was the first instruction. So, the answer is No.

If you always look forward, the directions assume you are facing in the direction you started. If you always face forward, directions assume you are facing in the direction you started. Therefore, the answer is no.

Forward facing always returns you to your original position. If you always face forward, and a person takes 6 steps forward, this means you always face forward and take 6 steps forward. The answer: No.

The first 5 steps should return you to the starting point. The first 7 steps should return you to the starting point. The first 10 steps should return you to what is already there. So, the answer is Yes.

If you face forward you go forward 1 step from the starting point. You would take 4 steps backwards if you were standing in front and facing forward. You would take 4 steps backwards if you were standing in front and facing down. You would take 3 steps left if you were standing in front and facing down. So, the answer is Yes.

You only take 2 steps on the left, then 5 steps on the right, then 8 steps on the left, then 6 steps on the right, and finally 19 steps on the left. The steps must be taken in reverse order or you get back to the starting spot. So, the answer is Yes.

If you’ reversing the direction, 1 is not the opposite of 4 steps right. Since 1 is facing towards the opposite direction, reversing is a forward motion.
